job_title: Medical Coder in Post Falls, ID
pros: This company cares about their employees!

job_title: Caregiver, CNA in Post Falls, ID
pros: The patients were the best part of this job.
cons: Had a real hard time keeping managers. We lost 3 Pre-op/PACU managers in under a year. Anesthesia chipped a patient’s dentures during surgery. They blamed the CNA for not asking about dentures when they were brought back to the surgical unit. In my 8+ years of working in surgical services, the Anesthesia provider always asks the patient about removable teeth, partials or dentures. They also look inside the patients mouth. This is standard practice before heading to the OR. Never felt valued as an employee. They always wanted more and more. Oh, and don't plan on relying on HR for anything. They were notorious for not returning your calls or being in their office when you need them. I could go on and on...

job_title: Medical Practice Manager in Post Falls, ID
pros: Unified team striving to serve the community we live in.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Post Falls, ID
pros: I have been with Northwest for a little over 3 years and I have never felt so valued and appreciated by a company. Even though the company is growing, they still show staff they care and promote a great work/life balance. I really love that they have all staff events where employees can bring there families and hang out together (the annual Pig Roast is my favorite!). I feel like there is a lot of growth opportunities and that the leadership follows a "grow your own" mentality, instead of hiring external people for advancement opportunities within the organization.
cons: The benefits could be better, with a lower deductible.

job_title: Regisered Nurse in Post Falls, ID
pros: This is a great hospital that really focuses on patient care and employees. They focus on culture and small things like employee appreciation days or fun events like barbeques and holiday parties. My co-workers are the best part of my job.
cons: Heavy patient volume during the start of the week rather than balanced throughout
